intro: Isachne buettneri, commonly known as the narrowleaf isachne, is a grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and narrow, blade-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the grass family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental potential and ecological value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
